Module brickGame
Package brickGame

Class Main

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
brickGame.Main
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameEngine.OnAction, EventListener, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ball, Board, Break, collisionChecker, Score
public class Main extends javafx.application.Application implements javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent>, GameEngine.OnAction
The main class for the Brick Game application. It extends Application, implements EventHandler for handling key events, and implements GameEngine.OnAction for game events. This class initializes the game components, manages the game state, and handles user input.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws Exception
      The main entry point of the JavaFX application. It initializes the game components, sets up the user interface, and starts the game engine.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary stage for the JavaFX application.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during application startup.
      See Also:
      • start(Stage)

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame()
      Pauses the game, displaying the pause screen and hiding the main game screen. Sets the resumeFlag to true, indicating that the game is in a paused state.
      See Also:
      • pauseGame()

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame()
      Saves the current game state, including level, score, heart count, and other parameters. Utilizes the GameLoaderSaver class to perform the actual saving process.
      See Also:
      • saveGame()

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)

      Parameters:

      See Also:

    • restartGame

      public void restartGame()
      Restarts the game, resetting level, heart count, score, and other parameters.
      See Also:
      • restartGame()

    • onUpdate

      public void onUpdate()
      Called when an update to the game state is needed. Handles the update of score and UI elements.
      Specified by:

    • onInit

      public void onInit()

    • onPhysicsUpdate

      public void onPhysicsUpdate()
      Called during the physics update phase of the game. Updates game physics, checks collisions, and manages bonuses such as chocos and gold balls.
      Specified by:
      onPhysicsUpdate in interface GameEngine.OnAction
      See Also:
      • onPhysicsUpdate()

    • onTime

      public void onTime(long time)
      Called to update the game time. Sets the current time for game-related calculations.
      Specified by:
      onTime in interface GameEngine.OnAction
      Parameters:
      time - The current game time.
      See Also:
      • onTime(long)
